# iaschooldata

**[Documentation](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/)** \|
**[Getting
Started](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/quickstart.html)**
\| **[Enrollment
Trends](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/enrollment-trends.html)**

Fetch and analyze Iowa public school enrollment data from the Iowa
Department of Education in R or Python.

## What can you find with iaschooldata?

**34 years of enrollment data (1992-2025).** 515,000 students today.
Over 320 districts. Here are ten stories hiding in the numbers:

1.  [Iowa’s enrollment is remarkably
    stable](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/enrollment-trends.html#iowas-enrollment-is-remarkably-stable) -
    Steady at ~500,000 for three decades
2.  [Des Moines is the only large
    district](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/enrollment-trends.html#des-moines-is-the-only-large-district) -
    33,000 students, 10x the next largest
3.  [The Hispanic transformation of
    Iowa](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/enrollment-trends.html#the-hispanic-transformation-of-iowa) -
    From 2% to 13% since 1992
4.  [COVID barely dented Iowa
    enrollment](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/enrollment-trends.html#covid-barely-dented-iowa-enrollment) -
    One of the smallest drops in the nation
5.  [Rural consolidation never
    stops](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/enrollment-trends.html#rural-consolidation-never-stops) -
    From 400+ to ~320 districts
6.  [56 districts have fewer than 300
    students](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/enrollment-trends.html#districts-have-fewer-than-300-students) -
    Small-town economics are brutal
7.  [Kindergarten is holding
    steady](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/enrollment-trends.html#kindergarten-is-holding-steady) -
    Unlike many states
8.  [English Learners have
    tripled](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/enrollment-trends.html#english-learners-have-tripled) -
    Rural schools now need ESL teachers
9.  [The urban-rural divide
    grows](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/enrollment-trends.html#the-urban-rural-divide-grows) -
    Two Iowas are emerging
10. [Iowa remains 80%
    white](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/enrollment-trends.html#iowa-remains-80-white) -
    Despite demographic shifts

See the [Enrollment Trends
vignette](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/articles/enrollment-trends.html)
for interactive visualizations and code examples.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Installation

``` r
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("almartin82/iaschooldata")
```

## Quick start

### R

``` r
library(iaschooldata)
library(dplyr)

# Fetch one year
enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)

# Fetch multiple years
enr_recent <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)

# Fetch ALL 34 years of data (1992-2025)
enr_all <- fetch_enr_multi(1992:2025)

# State totals
enr_2025 %>%
  filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")

# District breakdown
enr_2025 %>%
  filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%
  arrange(desc(n_students))

# Demographics by district
enr_2025 %>%
  filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL",
         subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%
  group_by(district_name, subgroup) %>%
  summarize(n = sum(n_students, na.rm = TRUE))
```

### Python

``` python
import pyiaschooldata as ia

# Check available years
years = ia.get_available_years()
print(f"Data available from {years['min_year']} to {years['max_year']}")

# Fetch one year
df = ia.fetch_enr(2025)

# Fetch multiple years
df_multi = ia.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025])

# State totals
state_total = df[(df['is_state'] == True) &
                 (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &
                 (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')]

# District breakdown
districts = df[(df['is_district'] == True) &
               (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &
               (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False)
```

## Data availability

| Years         | Source                        | Aggregation Levels      | Demographics | Notes                       |
|---------------|-------------------------------|-------------------------|--------------|-----------------------------|
| **1992-2025** | Iowa DOE Education Statistics | State, District, School | Race, Gender | 34 years of consistent data |

### What’s available

- **Levels:** State, district (~320), and school (~1,200)
- **Demographics:** White, Black, Hispanic, Asian, Native American,
  Pacific Islander, Multiracial
- **Grade levels:** Pre-K through Grade 12
- **Special populations:** English Learners, Free/Reduced Lunch

### ID System

Iowa uses an AEA (Area Education Agency) structure: - **District ID:**
4-digit code (e.g., 1350 for Des Moines) - **School ID:** Building
numbers within districts

## Data source

Iowa Department of Education: [Education
Statistics](https://educate.iowa.gov/pk-12/data/education-statistics)

## Part of the State Schooldata Project

A simple, consistent interface for accessing state-published school data
in Python and R.

**All 50 state packages:**
[github.com/almartin82](https://github.com/almartin82?tab=repositories&q=schooldata)

## Author

[Andy Martin](https://github.com/almartin82) (<almartin@gmail.com>)

MIT

# Package index

## Fetch Data

- [`fetch_enr()`](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/reference/fetch_enr.md)
  : Fetch Iowa enrollment data
- [`fetch_enr_multi()`](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/reference/fetch_enr_multi.md)
  : Fetch enrollment data for multiple years
- [`get_available_years()`](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/reference/get_available_years.md)
  : Get available years for Iowa enrollment data

## Process & Tidy

- [`tidy_enr()`](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/reference/tidy_enr.md)
  : Tidy enrollment data
- [`id_enr_aggs()`](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/reference/id_enr_aggs.md)
  : Identify enrollment aggregation levels
- [`enr_grade_aggs()`](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/reference/enr_grade_aggs.md)
  : Custom Enrollment Grade Level Aggregates

## Cache Management

- [`cache_status()`](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/reference/cache_status.md)
  : Show cache status
- [`clear_cache()`](https://almartin82.github.io/iaschooldata/reference/clear_cache.md)
  : Clear the iaschooldata cache
